Desc.entry: The Immigration Enquiry Bureau (based in Croydon) provides information about applications for permission to remain or settle in the UK, handles enquires about applications to work or study under the points-based system and is the place to contact in the first instance to book appointments at a public enquiry office (the Sheffield office is in Vulcan House, Millsands - access by appointment only, no personal callers). The Customer Contact Centre deals with enquires about residual work permits, applications to the Highly Skilled Migrant Programme, as well as general enquiries about the Worker Registration Scheme A8. Also offers guidance for Bulgarian and Romanian nationals wishing to work in the UK. The Sponsorship and Employers' Helpline provides information about the following: sponsorship under the new points-based system; verification of entitlement to work for people who are currently awaiting the outcome of an application made to the Home Office; the prevention of illegal working, especially advice about carrying out the document check necessary to attain a defence against conviction. Please see the website for more details.

ProvisionDaysAndTimes.entry: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm (except bank holidays). No personal callers, please contact by telephone only
